ã€

Thinking Elixir 232: Towering Over Errors

10 Dec 2024 by brainlid

Episode 232 of Thinking Elixir. News includes SaÅ¡a JuriÄ‡ updating his project for â€œThe Soul of Erlang and Elixirâ€ talk with the latest technologies, the release of Phoenix LiveView RC 8 with exciting new features, ErrorTracker v0.5.0â€™s enhancements for Ash applications, and the introduction of the NX MLX backend for Apple Silicon, offering efficient machine learning on Mac hardware. Plus, a new VS Code plugin called â€œRefactorexâ€ brings robust refactoring capabilities to Elixir. We also interview Gonzalo Rodriguez about Tower, a vendor-agnostic error tracking and reporting tool in Elixir, discussing its creation, functionality, and how it simplifies error management across various services. And more!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jM8499_Jfcg

ã€

Distributed applications with Elixir, a beginners' journey

23 Dec 2024 by dompdv

We have written a series of 3 articles about distributed applications.

It is written by beginners in the field, and is aimed at beginners. It is not a course on decentralized programming. They tell the story of our journey of discovery into the complex world of distributed applications.

(The articles are in French or English)

Olivier and Dominique

IEX's new "auto_reload" feature in Elixir 1.18

23 Dec 2024 by TheArrowsmith

Elixir 1.18 adds an :auto_reload config option to IEx. But when I tried it out, it didnâ€™t do quite what I expected.

After seeking clarification, I managed to figure it out. So Iâ€™ve written up a short post explaining everything you need to know about this nifty new feature:

https://arrowsmithlabs.com/blog/iex-configure-auto-reload

item.title: ã€ğŸ¥ Accelerating machine learning hardware development with Elixir ğŸ¥ã€‘ğŸ¥ ä½¿ç”¨ Elixir åŠ é€Ÿæœºå™¨å­¦ä¹ ç¡¬ä»¶å¼€å‘ ğŸ¥
item.description:
ã€

ğŸ¥ Accelerating machine learning hardware development with Elixir ğŸ¥

12 Dec 2024 by kamila-codesync

https://youtu.be/rXBYamvsAVQ

A talk by Isaac Yonemoto in which he talked about how Elixir was used at Positron to accelerate the process of developing machine learning hardware. The BEAM VM offered some incredible advantages in servicing ML workloads, and Isaac discussed these advantages from his perspective. Given that the current state of the art tends to use Python, he made specific comparisons to highlight the differences.

âœ¨This talk was recorded at Code BEAM America 2024. If youâ€™re curious about our upcoming event, check https://codebeamamerica.com âœ¨

item.title: ã€Thinking Elixir 233: LiveView 1.0 and Elixir 1.18!ã€‘æ€è€ƒ Elixir 233ï¼šLiveView 1.0 å’Œ Elixir 1.18ï¼
item.description:
ã€

Thinking Elixir 233: LiveView 1.0 and Elixir 1.18!

17 Dec 2024 by brainlid

Episode 233 of Thinking Elixir. News includes the long-awaited release of Phoenix LiveView 1.0, exciting enhancements in Elixir 1.18 such as built-in JSON support and improved ExUnit testing capabilities, and the unveiling of AWS Aurora DSQL, a serverless distributed PostgreSQL-compatible database service. Lars Wikman joins us to share updates about Nerves, including the latest on Nerves Hub, Nerves Cloud, and his project oswag.org where you can find official Elixir and Nerves T-shirts. All this and more!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-tFmyVjBGFM

Thinking Elixir 234: Source Drops, AI, and Holiday Cheer

24 Dec 2024 by brainlid

Episode 234 of Thinking Elixir. News includes Ellie Fairholm and JosÃ© Giralt Dâ€™Lacoste releasing the source code for â€œEngineering Elixir Applications,â€ Michael Russo introducing â€œhex2txtâ€ to enhance AI coding assistants, Brian Cardarella showcasing LiveView Nativeâ€™s LiveUploads, Headwayâ€™s guide on building AI-powered iOS apps with LiveView Native, and more! Wishing you a Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year from all of us!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YVoMur5zmrQ
